waves.rationale: US-004 adds Space-level page aggregation methods to pageStore. This creates the contract (interface) that multiple downstream stories depend on. Must complete first to establish the data access layer.

US-001 (SpaceNavigation.svelte), US-006 (pages/+page.ts), US-007 (api/pages/+server.ts) touch completely different files and have no shared dependencies beyond the completed US-004 store methods. These can safely run in parallel: UI component vs route loader vs API endpoint.

US-002 creates individual nav button components that US-001 (SpaceNavigation) will import. Must wait for US-001 to complete to understand the integration pattern, though they touch different files (nav/*.svelte vs SpaceNavigation.svelte).

US-005 (wire pageCount to PagesNavButton.svelte), US-008 (pages dashboard +page.svelte), US-014 (SelectAreaModal.svelte), US-015 (PageEmptyState.svelte) all touch different files. US-005 depends on US-004 (store methods) and US-002 (button component). US-008 depends on US-006 (load function). All prerequisites met, no file conflicts.

All section components for the pages dashboard: RecentlyEditedSection, AllPagesSection, PageFilterBar, PagesGrid, PageCard. Each is a separate .svelte file with no overlap. US-008 (parent dashboard) is complete, providing integration context. These leaf components can be built in parallel.

US-003 modifies SpaceDashboard.svelte to integrate the new SpaceNavigation component. Must wait until US-001 (SpaceNavigation) and US-002 (nav buttons) are complete and US-005 has wired the page count. This is an integration story that touches an existing file, so serialize to avoid conflicts.

US-016 adds optimistic update methods (addPage, refreshPagesForSpace) to pageStore. This modifies the same file as US-004 (pages.svelte.ts). Must serialize to avoid file conflict. Creates contract for US-017.

US-017 (optimistic updates in creation flows), US-018 (loading states), US-019 (accessibility), US-020 (mobile responsiveness) are all enhancement stories that touch different aspects of existing components. US-017 depends on US-016 (optimistic methods). US-018/19/20 are polish passes across multiple files with no direct conflicts. Can run in parallel as they address orthogonal concerns.

risks: US-004 and US-016 both modify pages.svelte.ts - correctly serialized in waves 1 and 7
US-001 and US-002 both work on navigation components - serialized (wave 2 then 3) to ensure clean integration pattern
US-003 integrates SpaceNavigation into SpaceDashboard - delayed to wave 6 after all nav components complete

US-017 modifies page creation flows across multiple files - potential conflicts if those files are being modified by US-018/19/20, but those are polish passes on different concerns (loading/a11y/mobile) so likely safe
Wave 5 has 5 parallel stories building leaf components - high parallelism but low risk since they're all net-new files
